reviews.review_msg: This was not a too difficult course as Dr. Martin gave you the topics for the inclass writing assignments (ICW). Attending lectures is good as he explains thoroughly what you are expected to write for the assignments. However, lectures were pretty dry and not very engaging. He sometimes just read off his text so this added more boredom to the class

Not sure what people are talking about when they recommend this prof. Whole course grade based on 3 writing assignments. Even though I went to every class, took notes, did readings and prepared extensively for in class writing assignments, I still got an average grade. Exam questions were not straightforward and marking was extremely unreasonable
Real professor in university.  Amazing lecture.  He even got a letter from BF Skinner !

Dr. Martin tells history by using 'stories' and he does it well although the lectures can get a bit long and boring. It's important to come because there are little details you should remember for the the assignments. The assignments are fair but I suggest asking the TA's a bunch of questions beforehand because they are the ones who mark it.
Knows his history very well.
Work load are all in class writing and will be given topics to prepare first. Although there are lots of things you need to study, you will do well if you prepare ready.

Loved him! He was rly helpful and kind. u dont need to come to every class, since slides cover everything. TAKE ADVANTAGE of office hrs and  be friends with ur TA - they mark ur papers; so talk to them and get help when needed.  Got A- becuz i asked TA for clarification each time (evn tho I skipped often lol oop)

I took this course with another prof but i dropped it before the first midterm -- that's how much i hated history. but with Dr. Martin it's a different story. he and his TA are just so awesome! no textbooks, marks are based on three in-class writings. he gave two possible topics two weeks ahead so you get more than enough time to prepare. TAKE IT!!

Jack is a brilliant man - and not in a pompous way! You will respect him and his intelligence immensely by taking 308 with him. I personally hate history but he made it bearable. He really wants us to succeed and gives us many opportunities to prepare for the in class writing assignments. no textbook, no exams but you must attend lecture to do well

If you're into history, you will enjoy this class. Lectures are NOT recorded and discussions follow each lecture. Easy to pass if you read the articles, lecture notes, and write papers in advance. There will be three in-class essay assignments - one of two essay questions will be asked. You will have two weeks to prepare for each assignment.

This professor is the professor that you really deserve. Knowledgeable, sophisticated, helpful, fair. I got a man crush on this guy after this semester. No assignments, exams are all lecture & reading based. No textbook. You can get a decent grade even if you pull an allnighter. If you actually put effort, you can get an A+. A True Psych Professor

There is no required text but that being said, read the provided articles! He's a great speaker, his lectures are organized as stories which have proven to be fairly interesting even though I've always associated "history" with boredom. He's even got a handwritten letter from BF Skinner! Awesome prof, all around.

Dr. Martin is a passionate and kind person. Although history courses are not my favorite, Dr. Martin intrigues me with his passion. He's a fair marker, you will get the mark you deserve. Do the readings before class so you can participate in the discussion!

An excellent prof with superb teaching skills. I truly enjoyed all the lectures and found all the articles he'd selected for reading very useful. The three in-class written assignments weren't extremely hard IF you'd studied. Great structure - great course. I wish all the profs at SFU were this knowledgeable and articulate.

This course was way easier than I thought. Had 3 in-class writing assignments that consisted of 3 questions. We were given 2 possible questions 2 weeks in advance and were asked to answer 1 of them on the day. I definitely recommend going to see the TA before preparing your paper. They're the ones that are going to mark it.

Awesome prof! I was dreading the class prior to semester but it ended up being my favourite class. He teaches history like a story, cracks jokes and makes class engaging. In class writing assignments are straight forward; participate in discussion, talk to the TA bc she marks them, and prep a couple of days in advance.

Great prof! No assignments or exams- only 3 in class essays (pick 1 out of 2 questions) AND he gives them to you 2 weeks ahead! Lots of time to prepare using articles & in class discussion. Attendance is mandatory because you discuss the essay questions as a group
No textbook required
Midterms straightfoward, fairly easy class

Although he's clearly passionate about the subject matter, Jack makes the content seem more uninteresting and boring than he should have. The bullet points in his lecture slides are essays, which is extremely off-putting and discouraging. The exams were quite fair... just make sure you know your stuff!

Jack really knows a lot about his field, but his lectures seem disorganized and confusing. Study his lecture notes only, exams are entirely based off lecture material. Videos waste time and are not testable. Final assignment is abstract and requires covering too much unrelated material.

Very good prof+ fair exams even tho exams were written the questions werent hard as long as you follow what he says: study on things in the textbook AND his lecture. ignore all other things. I agree that he sometimes goes off on a tangent and says so on and so forth a lil too much. :) altho hes a very nice/reasonable guy despite his stern look

great lecturer! only test on materials in lecture & textbook... so if not in either or, its not testable... makes the most boring thing interesting... its not tat easy to get a great mark on the exams but its decent...  exams are not cumulative!

He's a good lecturer, if not a little long. Usually lectures for half the class, shows a film the other half, then discussion. Really good at relating the history to modern psych. Anyways, the class didn't suck even though I HATE history. I did pretty good on the exams, too, with moderate effort. Very fair exams, they don't take long.
Great Prof! Loved his class - exactly what you would want of a Univ. Prof! He tries to help as much as he can so you get a good grade: practice midterms - just show up for class..

I enjoyed this class. Despite his tendency to be slightly awkward, it does come across that Jack is interested in the topic he teaches. The final and midterm had a dozen or so questions and were worth around 30% each, which I found somewhat irritating. Nevertheless, his lectures were effective at attempting to address such a broad topic.

To be fair, he's a decent prof and pretty nice guy but sometimes he does tend to tangent on random things. Furthermore, he is like an energizer bunny in that he keeps going for a long time. Exams are fair but not super easy. The key is to exclusively study slides and if you don't understand then read book. Ended up being better than I expected.
I think his lectures are very entertaining and he does not have a monotonous voice. I guess one must love the subject to appreciate his passion for it. Love this class!
not a bad teacher, lecture can be boring and dry
Jack is a wonderful lecturer. He is knowledgeable, approachable, and helpful. The exams are fair...there is no need to memorize the nitty gritty details.

I truly enjoyed attending lecture. The material can be a bit dry because it is history but he makes it engaging. The exams were fair, all written so you have to know your stuff. If you take good notes during lecture and study off of them for the exams you should do fine. Just use the text for extra reading and understanding.

It's too bad the material is so dry. Jack's not a bad prof, but there's a lot of material and it's just really boring stuff. Good things about this class is there's no paper (12 1 page responses to the week's lecture that are pass/fail) and the exams are fair. I heard the last prof to teach this class was a witch so if you can take with Jack,do it.

Material is so boring, and Jack's lectures are not very exciting. I do sympathize with him because I can't imagine any way to make this stuff interesting. No multiple choice on exams, all short answers, but most of the questions are fair.

History of Psych. isn't an exciting course to begin with, but Jack doesn't help. His lectures are a bit dull, although he does show the occasional film. Sometimes he slips into a mono-tone lecture voice, or starts droning on about un-related material. Exams are fair, 10 written answer questions. Pretty darn boring though.
Great Prof.
